channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon Musk predicts jobs will become ‘kinda like a hobby’
item.description: "In a benign scenario probably none of us will have a job."

item.title: Former TikTok CEO Kevin Mayer says AI hype is at an all-time fever pitch right now
item.description: Former TikTok CEO and Candle Media co-CEO Kevin Mayer believes that the hype around artificial intelligence has reached a crescendo.

item.title: Goldman Sachs pushes back timing for first Fed rate cut to September
‘A glaring blind spot’ in housing affordability: Mortgage underwriting and home appraisals should account for energy costs. Here’s why
item.description: Ensuring home affordability is crucial to protecting the American Dream, but the monthly mortgage payment is just one part of the cost of owning a home.

item.title: Nvidia's stock split makes it a Dow contender — but not a shoo-in
item.description: An index committee looks for a stock with "an excellent reputation" and sustained growth that is "of interest to a large number of investors."

item.title: U.K. retail sales fall a sharper-than-forecast 2.3% in April
Fake AI-generated Biden robocalls orchestrator faces $6m fine and criminal charges
item.description: The Federal Communications Commission said the fine it proposed for Steven Kramer is its first involving generative AI technology.

item.title: Chinese EV makers continue aggressive push into Europe under growing threat of tariffs
item.description: Nio, Xpeng and BYD have continued their European expansion even as an ongoing EU probe into Chinese electric vehicle subsidies could result in tariffs.

item.title: 401(k) millionaires surged 43% in past year — here’s how long it took to hit $1M
Tiny Scottish island, with more sheep than people, becomes the U.K.'s first spaceport for vertical rockets
item.description: Former military site, SaxaVord, is one of seven spaceports being built around the U.K. in the wake of new laws encouraging private investment in the space industry.

item.title: British retail sales plunge 2.3% in April, missing estimates
item.description: U.K. retail sales volumes dropped 2.3% in April as wet weather deterred shoppers, the Office for National Statistics said Friday.

item.title: Podcast: Why the inflation numbers and Dow 40,000 aren’t worth celebrating
Louisiana legislature approves bill that would punish the possession of abortion pills without a prescription with hefty fines and jail time
item.description: Two abortion-inducing drugs could soon be reclassified as controlled and dangerous substances in Louisiana under a first-of-its-kind bill that received final legislative passage Thursday.

item.title: F1 dispute with Andretti Global draws in U.S. lawmakers
item.description: A dispute over whether to accept American motorsports giant Andretti Global as Formula One's 11th team is reaching boiling point.

item.title: Why the Live Nation antitrust case might not make concert tickets cheaper
